newsitem.title: USA: Brown's Famous Footwear April same store sales off.
newsitem.headline: Brown's Famous Footwear April same store sales off.

text.p: Brown Group Inc said Thursday that April same store sales for its Famous Footwear division dropped 4.4 percent, which followed a 9.3 percent increase in March.
Sales for Famous Footwear in April were $60.3 million, up 0.3 percent.
For the first quarter, Famous Footwear same store sales rose 3.5 percent, which was "slightly higher than planned," Harry Rich, chief financial officer, said in a statement.
"Athletic footwear and children's shoes performed well throughout the quarter, and women's casual shoes and sandals also sold well until poor April weather dampened that business," Rich said.
Brown Group said its Naturalizer division's sales decreased 2.4 percent in April to $11.1 million, and its same-store sales were down 1.9 percent.
For the first quarter, Naturalizer's sales fell 6.3 percent to $30.9 million and same-store sales dropped 5.5 percent.
"Fresh spring merchandise, including sandals and casual footwear, sold well in the Naturalizer Retail stores, helping offset continuing lower dress shoe sales," Rich said.
